name: Doctor Lesko

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Yes, what did you need?

topics.topic_text: Let me ask you something else.
topics.response_text: Yes?

topics.topic_text: Can we skip the story and get to a solution?
topics.response_text: Oh, my. I suppose I do tend to ramble on about all things academic.

topics.topic_text: What the hell are you doing down here?
topics.response_text: Well, I might ask you the same thing.

topics.topic_text: Hey! You're that egghe... I mean scientist the kid was talking about.
topics.response_text: Well, yes. I suppose I am.

topics.topic_text: Sorry, I didn't expect to bump into anyone alive down here.
topics.response_text: That is precisely why this is the ideal place for my work.

topics.topic_text: Creep up on YOU? I just crapped my pants for crying out loud!
topics.response_text: That's no way to talk to a man of science!

topics.topic_text: Experiments? What do you mean?
topics.response_text: My experiments are of a complex nature and would take a scientist to explain... oh wait! I'm a scientist! How marvelous!

topics.topic_text: You call this a laboratory?
topics.response_text: I've chosen this room as a temporary retreat from which to contemplate my erroneous figures for my experiments.

topics.topic_text: How about we start the experiment by decorating that wall with your brains?
topics.response_text: Oh my! Such rude behavior!

topics.topic_text: Oh, I see. You're trying to make them smaller over time by injecting the eggs.
topics.response_text: My word! You understand perfectly! How marvelous!

topics.topic_text: Okay, now how about explaining that for the slower people?
topics.response_text: Hmmm. Let me see. Well... You start with a generation of very large ants.

topics.topic_text: Okay, okay. Enough with the mumbo jumbo.
topics.response_text: Yes, it's fairly obvious you have no clue what I'm dealing with here. Let me explain to you, as I would to a child.

topics.topic_text: Slow down, professor... Once more in English, okay?
topics.response_text: It's always staggering just how low the intellectual level of the typical Wastelander appears to be. Let me try and explain.

topics.topic_text: So, what's gone wrong?
topics.response_text: Well. I'm afraid I've made slight miscalculations in the mutagen. Instead of lowering their size, the brood hatched with a new biomechanism.

topics.topic_text: Are you aware your new ants breathe fire?!
topics.response_text: Well, this is rather embarrassing so you'll have to forgive me, it appears that I've made a slight miscalculation in my mutagen samples.

topics.topic_text: I've got news for you, brainiac. It ain't working.
topics.response_text: Hmph. I don't expect a common Wastelander to understand the intricacies of an experiment this delicate.

topics.topic_text: So all that needs to be done is eliminate the remaining Ants?
topics.response_text: I'm afraid it's not that simple. The mutagen has already been injected into the Ant Queen. She has enough in her body to last for years.

topics.topic_text: An error? People have died, Lesko!
topics.response_text: A small price to pay for the advancement of science.

topics.topic_text: I'm shocked you didn't attempt this in a controlled environment first.
topics.response_text: Your knowledge of experimental procedure surprises me!

topics.topic_text: Ha! You call yourself a scientist? That's rich.
topics.response_text: There's no need to be rude! Science must learn to crawl before it walks.

topics.topic_text: I may be able to help, but it will cost you.
topics.response_text: Imagine. Years from now... the entire population of ants in the Wasteland, back to the size of a peanut.

topics.topic_text: It was for the greater good Lesko. Man is not ready to play God.
topics.response_text: Perhaps man isn't ready, my friend. Not today, but maybe someday.

topics.topic_text: Your theories were in error, and beyond correction. I had no choice.
topics.response_text: Spoken like a true disciple of science! I will restart my calculations from the beginning and learn to crawl before I try to run.

topics.topic_text: I can't let you risk people's lives for an experiment.
topics.response_text: You utter buffoon! You've set my work back months... perhaps even years!

topics.topic_text: Because you're out of your mind!
topics.response_text: You utter buffoon! You've set my work back months... perhaps even years!

topics.topic_text: If it'll stop the ants from burning down Grayditch, I'm in.
topics.response_text: You will? How marvelous!

topics.topic_text: What can I do to help?
topics.response_text: Since you've offered, allow me to elaborate.

topics.topic_text: What exactly do you need?
topics.response_text: My portable terminal is set up in the Hatchery Chamber near the Ant Queen. If I can reach it, I can continue to work on improving the mutagen.

topics.topic_text: So? It's your mistake Doc, you fix it.
topics.response_text: Please, don't insult my intelligence. Had I been able to correct this error easily I would have done so long before you arrived.

topics.topic_text: If the Queen's your concern, why not deal with it directly?
topics.response_text: If she were harmed in any way, months of data would be lost.

topics.topic_text: Why not just kill the Queen and be done with it?
topics.response_text: If I were to do that months of data would be lost. No, no... the Queen must remain completely unharmed.

topics.topic_text: So you want me to pop the Queen, huh?
topics.response_text: Oh! No, no, no! The Queen mustn't be harmed at all! Months of work would be lost!

topics.topic_text: Just how will all this undo the mayhem you've caused?
topics.response_text: I've rigged the equipment at my portable terminal to emit what I call an Inhibitor Pulse.

topics.topic_text: This will stop the Fire Ants?
topics.response_text: No, it should all wrap up rather nicely.  I've rigged my equipment at my portable terminal to emit what I call an Inhibitor Pulse.

topics.topic_text: I hope that's everything, I've had enough of ants.
topics.response_text: Yes, it should all wrap up rather nicely. I've rigged my equipment at my portable terminal to emit what I call an Inhibitor Pulse.

topics.topic_text: I'd be glad to help him. Who is he?
topics.response_text: He's a rather bothersome young lad. Always asking interminable questions and interrupting my calculations.

topics.topic_text: Wilks? I have no idea what you mean.
topics.response_text: He's a rather bothersome young man. Always asking interminable questions and interrupting my calculations.

topics.topic_text: Who the hell is Bryan Wilks?
topics.response_text: He's a rather bothersome young lad. Always asking interminable questions and interrupting my calculations.

topics.topic_text: Let me get back to you on this.
topics.response_text: Very well, I've waited this long, a bit longer won't make much difference.

topics.topic_text: This is a hefty task, Doc. I'm going to need serious incentive.
topics.response_text: Yes, I suppose you're right. Science must learn to acquiesce to your standards in order to advance itself.

topics.topic_text: Books aren't going to buy me new ammunition.
topics.response_text: Why can't man follow the ant's example? They work together as a team... every waking moment dedicated to the colony.

topics.topic_text: You want help? Fork over some caps, Einstein.
topics.response_text: Why can't man follow the ant's example? They work together as a team... every waking moment dedicated to the colony.

topics.topic_text: Mutagenic Bio-what?
topics.response_text: I've managed to isolate some of the Fire Ant genes and distill them into human-safe genetic enhancers!

topics.topic_text: What else can you tell me about these Fire Ants?
topics.response_text: Well, the mutagen has enhanced their fortitude and provided them with what I call pyrosis; the ability to emit flame biologically.

topics.topic_text: How did you go from changing their size to breathing fire?
topics.response_text: Playing with genetic codes isn't simple... do you realize one tiny tweak at any point in the last million years could have completely changed us?

topics.topic_text: Will anything special hurt the Ants?
topics.response_text: I'm afraid they are not susceptible to anything I can think of that wouldn't harm the garden-variety Giant Ant.

topics.topic_text: Ants exhibit class system behavior, so I'll try and kill the Queen fast.
topics.response_text: Must I again remind you that the Queen is to remain completely unharmed!?

topics.topic_text: How the heck can an ant breathe fire?
topics.response_text: The stimulation of the subject's evolutionary trigger by the mutagen caused a bio-defensive reaction metamorphosing the ant's venom glands.

topics.topic_text: What should I do about Bryan Wilks?
topics.response_text: You should take him away from this place; find him a home.

topics.topic_text: Can't you take responsibility for his father's death?
topics.response_text: All scientists take responsibility for their failures, because it comes with the territory.

topics.topic_text: Don't you realize you've ruined his entire life?
topics.response_text: You have your ideals and I have mine. I'm down here to complete my experiments at any cost.

topics.topic_text: You should have at least told him you were alive. He thought he was alone.
topics.response_text: I can't risk leaving this place... I have to continue monitoring the Hatchery for any further mutations in the next brood!

topics.topic_text: My work is done, Doctor.
topics.response_text: Oh, how marvelous! Please, tell me what happened.

topics.topic_text: I've killed all the Nest Guardians.
topics.response_text: Then I will proceed to my portable terminal at once and make the necessary changes to the formula.

topics.topic_text: I've killed all the Nest Guardians [Lie]
topics.response_text: Then I will proceed to my portable terminal at once and make the necessary changes to the formula.

topics.topic_text: I've killed all of the Nest Guardians, but I destroyed your mutagen supply.
topics.response_text: What?!! How could you do such a foolish thing?

topics.topic_text: Actually, my mistake... I'm not done yet.
topics.response_text: Oh now this is really too much!

topics.topic_text: I've killed the Ant Queen.
topics.response_text: What?! How could you do such a thing?

topics.topic_text: I've killed the Ant Queen and I destroyed your mutagen supply.
topics.response_text: You utter buffoon! You've set my work back months... perhaps even years!

topics.topic_text: So, what will you do now, Doctor?
topics.response_text: Well, I will continue my research. There has to be a way to reduce these creatures to their former size.

topics.topic_text: Why are there Fire Ants still down in the Metro tunnels?
topics.response_text: I'm afraid that's my fault. The last mutagen sample was given to the Ant Queen's entire brood.

topics.topic_text: So, what are you going to do now about your experiments?
topics.response_text: Well, I'm uncertain. This does deal quite a blow to my research.

topics.topic_text: Hey, Doc. Will this Fire Ant Nectar do you any good?
topics.response_text: Why, yes it would.

topics.topic_text: MS04LeskoPasswordNote
topics.response_text: This could be the fifth time I've forgotten the code to my desktop terminal. I really must learn to be more organized.

topics.topic_text: I'm ready for my Mutagenic Bioenhancer injection and Lab Coat, Doctor.
topics.response_text: How marvelous! Here is the promised Lab Coat. I'm certain you'll find it quite useful.

topics.topic_text: I'd like the Ant Sight to increase my perception.
topics.response_text: How marvelous! Ant Sight it is! Hold still please.

topics.topic_text: I'd like the Ant Might to increase my physical strength.
topics.response_text: How marvelous! Ant Might it is! Hold still please.

topics.topic_text: Actually, I'm not ready yet.
topics.response_text: Very well. Return to me when you're ready.

topics.topic_text: About your experiments...
topics.response_text: Oh my yes, they're quite marvelous!

topics.topic_text: What's the goal of your experiments?
topics.response_text: By introducing my mutagen directly into an ant egg, I hope to reduce the size of the adults.

topics.topic_text: Something isn't right. You shouldn't have gotten results like these so quickly.
topics.response_text: Well... ummm, I may have used a few... ahem, shortcuts. Yes.

topics.topic_text: How exactly can I destroy the mutagen?
topics.response_text: Destroy? Oh no no no!

description:
Dr. Weston Lesko is a 55 year-old Caucasian Male.

A brilliant but aloof entomologist who has established a laboratory in Marigold station, Grayditch. Driven by a scientific curiosity and a desire to help the wasteland, he is attempting to genetically manipulate giant ant eggs to revert them to their pre-War size. Despite understanding the risks, he remains confident in his research methods and the potential benefits to the community.

Dr. Weston Lesko's Personality: Brilliant yet socially detached, Dr. Lesko is intensely focused on his scientific pursuits. He possesses an unwavering belief in the righteousness of his cause and views his work as a noble endeavor to improve the wasteland. While he may come across as condescending to those who don't understand his methods, he genuinely believes he's helping both the people and the ants of the region.

Dr. Weston Lesko's Backstory: Before arriving in Grayditch, Dr. Lesko was a promising entomologist in the pre-War scientific community. When the Great War came, he survived in an underground laboratory, continuing his research in isolation. By 2276, he emerged from his shelter and established himself in the Capital Wasteland. In early 2277, he relocated to Grayditch, drawn by the presence of the giant ant colony. With the assistance of Fred and Bryan Wilks, he constructed a laboratory at Marigold station, where he began his ambitious genetic experiments on ant eggs, hoping to demonstrate that the mutated creatures are not monsters but misunderstood beings that can be helped.
